graphicalElements.text: A couple of very self confident guys order their drinks with you. The two individuals keep observing a group of girls at the end of the bar. The guys seem interested in the girls and look somewhat suspicious to you. How do you handle the situation?
Be aware of your tone and comments. If it seems judgemental or sarcastic, it's not the best way to establish a rapport.
It's good to engage customers in conversation. Next time try using an open question enquiring what they have planned for the night.
This comment may seem judgemental, but it's good to let them know you're being observant.
This kind of response ends a conversation. A more engaging conversation would provide opportunities to determine sobriety & other general information about the person.
It's good to indicate you observe patrons around you! Maybe try to be more inquisitive rather than "suspicious".
This response may seem abrupt and could end the conversation. Possibly preventing you from gathering relevant information about the customer.
Well done. Polite but also revealing you observe who is around you and what they do.
Perfect! You emphasised the unusual order! Feel free to also ask who the extra shots of vodka are for.
Unengaging responses prevent you from developing a rapport and gathering relevant information about your customers.
Keep an eye of the group
Keep an eye on the group
Well done! Drink spiking is a crime and you've acted immediately. It's your duty to intervene.
Drink spiking is a crime. Once you have witnessed this you need to intervene straight away!
Yes, that's it! The most important thing is unquestionably to prevent further spiking or danger by confronting the offender.
You are confronting the offender, well done! Try to be more assertive, given the seriousness of these circumstances.
Even if the girl asked for the extra shots, adding shots to another person's drink is still against the law!
Yes, always record every detail! But don't let the offender leave.
Never let the offender leave until all the due diligence is completed!
You mastered it! Don't let them leave!
Drink spiking is a serious crime. Even if you are not sure you need to follow the house policies and investigate immediately.
Good to see you're following the house policies. Even if you just suspect drink spiking, it is a serious crime. So act promptly, confidently and assertively.
